      • asList

        public static <T> java.util.List<T> asList(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,T> map)
        Get a list that is read and write to the given map. The list will use the positive integer keys only.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the elements on the returned list
        Parameters:
        map - to get the list for

        a list for the given map
        Throws:

      • asMap

        public static <T> java.util.Map<java.lang.String,T> asMap(java.lang.Object object)
        Get a map that whenever the method Map.put(Object, Object) is invoked to it. It will put the value to an existing PUBLIC NON-FINALE field with the name of the key's value (only if it is string). And whenever the method Map.get(Object) is invoked to it. It will get the value of an existing PUBLIC field.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of values on the returned map
        Parameters:
        object - the instance
        Returns:
        a remote map to that instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given object is null

      • asMap

        public static <T> java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,T> asMap(java.util.List<T> list)
        Get a map that is read and write to the given list. The map will use the indexes as the keys of the elements on the given list.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of values on the returned map
        Parameters:
        list - to get a map for
        Returns:
        a map for the given list
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given 'list' is null
